item.description:
Hello All,

If you haven't already experienced the White Mountains in the Fall, here is your chance.

The Brettl-Hupfers are doing a group hike via the Zealand loop.  Its about a 6-8 hour intermediate hike with a stop towards the end at the Zealand hut to enjoy the views. No cliff climbing... but some gradual and moderate grade terrain. 

Here is a summary:

http://www.rei.com/guidepost/detail/new-hampshire/hiking/mount-hale-zealand-loop/30247

This is a very casual hike and planning is as such (with exception of the start time).

 

If you are interested, sign up. Its $15/ night to stay at the club (collected at the door) and we will most likely go out someplace in North Conway for dinner and such after we come home and get cleaned up.  Bring your own lunch. The lodge has refrigerators and there is a deli just down the road for any sort of things you have missed.

Many of us come up Friday night and stay until Sunday.. so feel free to come up for the entire weekend!  Its a beautiful area and lets hope for great weather.  If the weather is lousy, we may cancel the trip.

 

When:  Leave house at 9AM sharp

What: Hiking the Zealand loop via Mt Hale to the Zealand Hut. About 6-8 hours

$15/night

BYO: Lunch / snacks and bedding

21+ please.

If you have any questions, post here and I will get back with answers etc. Paul

 

About the house and members: www.brettl.org

This is open to club members and guests. Note: Attendance #s may vary from what shows on the meetup site.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Charlie stops to tell me something...

"If a man is all alone in the woods, and

there are no women around, is he still wrong?"

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A view from the Hut

 

 

 

 

After a long hike, we relax at the falls
item.how_to_find_us: We are located on the corner of Rte 302 and George St in Bartlett, NH. You can respond here or send an email to brettl.hupfers(at)gmail.com with a subject line of "Hiking"
item.name: Hiking the Zealand Loop
